intro: Artanthe elongata, commonly known as the long-stemmed artanthe, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from white to pale pink. Artanthe elongata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
